<title level="1" right="Rules">[Special Senses](/Rules.aspx?ID=2409)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 433 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
While a [human](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=64) might have a difficult time making creatures out in [dim light](/Rules.aspx?ID=2403), an [elf](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=60) can see those creatures just fine. And though elves have no problem seeing on a moonlit night, their vision can’t penetrate complete [darkness](/Rules.aspx?ID=2404), whereas a [dwarf’s](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=59) can. Special senses allow a creature to ignore or reduce the effects of the [undetected](/Rules.aspx?ID=2417), [hidden](/Rules.aspx?ID=2416), or [concealed](/Rules.aspx?ID=2419) conditions when it comes to situations that foil average vision.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
